titleInfo.title: Photomontage of landscapes, a beauty contestant, a woman holding cherry blossoms, a singer, a lion, and President Hoover with Secretaries of State. Nashville Banner, 1929 April 7.

mods.abstract: Photomontage of Shenandoah National Park, a beauty contestant, a woman holding cherry blossoms in Washington, D. C., a singer from Nashville slated to perform at the Ryman Auditorium, a lion at the London Zoo, U. S. Secretaries of State standing with President Hoover, and Kirkpatrick Lake near Gallatin, Tennessee. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.

originInfo.publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS 3.5 from a Qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/digitallibraryoftennessee/DLTN_XSLT. Metadata originally created in a locally modified version of Qualified Dublin Core using ContentDM (data dictionary available: https://wiki.lib.utk.edu/display/DPLA).
